column2: Do databases need manual updates before the product can be deployed?
Does the product require a single platform?
Are operational metrics generated by the product?
Are database updates automated?
Is the product decomposed into independently deployable components?
Is the API to the product versioned and documented?
Are the components of the product designed to allow low-level testing?
Are all the dependencies and the product libraries versioned and managed?
Are all database changes checked onto a version control system?
Are there multiple versions of the product currently under development?
Are large scale changes made incrementally? (introduce an abstraction around code to be replaced)
Does the team treat application config resources as versioned artifacts?
Can product capabilities be turned on and off at runtime (a.k.a. feature toggling)?
Does the team regularly refactor the code to prevent technical debt and improve quality?
Does the team refactor code to reduce complexity and increase modularity?
Is the product composed of independent components which can be evolved individually?
Is the product composed of components which can be release independently of other parts of the product?
Does the product generate and publish business metrics for operational monitoring and management?
Does the product generate complete transactional records in production for monitoring, management and trouble shooting?
Are infrastructure operations and configuration scripted and checked in the source code management system?
